sentences: Harvard-MIT Division of Health Sciences and Technology
[LIST_ITEM] Mammalian organ vital for fetal life
[LIST_ITEM] Acts as interface between fetal and maternal environments
[LIST_ITEM] Source of pregnancy-associated hormones and growth factors
[LIST_ITEM] Protects the fetal "allograft" from maternal immune system
[LIST_ITEM] The placenta forms from zygotic tissues and the first cell type to differentiate is the trophoblast
[LIST_ITEM] By the end of the third week the placenta is functioning
[LIST_ITEM] The human placental cell types include:
[LIST_ITEM] Stroma - macrophages (Hofbauer cells), fibrocytes, Wharton's jelly
[LIST_ITEM] pinopods, microvilli, apical protrusions present at 20-23 days
[LIST_ITEM] absorb molecules and fluid from lumen
[LIST_ITEM] increase apposition of embryo and endometrium
[LIST_ITEM] Ovum captured in distal portion of tube
[LIST_ITEM] Cleavage occurs during these 4 days but no change in size (no cell growth) - 150um
[LIST_ITEM] Human mode unknown but probably intrusive
[LIST_ITEM] attaches to epithelium and heads for decidua
[LIST_ITEM] Embryo "targets" hypoepithelial vessels on surface of endometrium
[LIST_ITEM] Surface is made receptive for the embryo
[LIST_ITEM] facultative (rat, red kangaroo only during stress)
[LIST_ITEM] facultative (Alaska fur seal, mink, bear always)
[LIST_ITEM] free floating morula/blastocyst with min. met. act.
[LIST_ITEM] Light cycle control duration of delay
[LIST_ITEM] Control over the initial cell fate decision is unclear
[LIST_ITEM] After blastocoel forms, signalling between the ICM and the trophectoderm are critical
[LIST_ITEM] Trophectoderm spatially most distant from ICM become TGC
[LIST_ITEM] ICM expresses Fgf4, trophectoderm expressed Fgfr2
[LIST_ITEM] Fgf4 ko embryos are lethal YET Fgf4 -/- stem cells are viable
[LIST_ITEM] Oct4 ko lack ICM but make trophectoderm if Fgf4 given
[LIST_ITEM] Fgfr dominant negative constructs block trophoblast proliferation
[LIST_ITEM] Trophoblast “stem cells” require Fgf4, withdrawn will differentiate to TGC
[LIST_ITEM] As the trophoblast grows it branches and increases its surface area
[LIST_ITEM] Molecules involved in this process are same as involved in branching morphogenesis in other organs (e.g. lung, kidney)
[LIST_ITEM] Branching morphogenesis - Fgf and others downstream/ signal transduction: Grb2, Gab1, Sos1 Mek1
[LIST_ITEM] Wnt canonical pathway via Tcf1 and Lef1
[LIST_ITEM] Coordination of vascular pattern with villous pattern varies amongst species
[LIST_ITEM] In human, the villi form first then vessels “come in”
[LIST_ITEM] Mother’s immune system has to protect the mother and fetus against pathogens and prevent the rejection of the semi-allergeneic feto-placental unit
[LIST_ITEM] Potential for repeated pregnancies with same paternity potentially triggering immune memory
[LIST_ITEM] Fetal alloantigens are recognized by maternal adaptive immune system
[LIST_ITEM] Innate immune response during implantation involves complement activation and neutrophil infiltration
[LIST_ITEM] Complement regulatory proteins prevent overdrive of complement activation in successful pregnancies
[LIST_ITEM] Complement mediated cell lysis is regulated by factors:
[LIST_ITEM] C3 deposition at maternal-fetal interface results in hemorrhagic necrosis and neutrophil infiltration leading to fetal resorption
[LIST_ITEM] Crry -/- crossed with C3 -/- produce viable fetuses
[LIST_ITEM] C3 deficient mothers have no fetal injury even when injected with aPL which results in antibody deposition in the decidua
[LIST_ITEM] T-Cell dependent inflammation inhibited by IDO
[LIST_ITEM] Tryptophan is needed for cell proliferation and is lower in pregnant than in non-pregnant women
[LIST_ITEM] IDO is expressed by syncytiotrophoblast, macrophages, and antigen presenting cells
[LIST_ITEM] Macrophages suppress T cell activity due to degradation of tryptophan by IDO
[LIST_ITEM] Treatment with an IDO inhibitor leads to inflammation, complement deposition and hemorrhagic necrosis at fetomaternal interface
[LIST_ITEM] Nonclassical HLA class I molecule expressed in trophoblasts, amnion, and thymic epithelial cells
[LIST_ITEM] 7 distinct protein isoforms each encoded by a specific alternatively spliced transcript
[LIST_ITEM] 4 are membrane bound and 3 are soluble
[LIST_ITEM] Inhibit NK cell mediated cytolysis and Ag specific CD8+ T cell mediated cytolysis HLA-G and Implantation
[LIST_ITEM] Normally highly expressed by invading trophoblast
[LIST_ITEM] Greatly reduced in trophoblasts from spontaneous abortions and in patients with preeclampsia
[LIST_ITEM] Zygotic expression of soluble HLA-G is required for blastocyst attachment
-Heterodimers composed of $\alpha$ and $\beta$ subunits -Ligand specificity a function of $\alpha\beta$ heterodimer -May bind to several ligands -Ligand may bind to several heterodimers
[LIST_ITEM] infertility? Related to reduced endometrial expression of $\beta_{3}$
[LIST_ITEM] defect in embryonic expression of $\beta_{1}$ causes involution of inner cell mass but preserves trophoblast
[LIST_ITEM] Distribution of the integrins either promotes or retards attachment
[LIST_ITEM] Early trophoblast exhibits $\alpha_{5}\beta_{1}$ but later changes to $\alpha_{1}\beta_{1}$

[NUMBERED_ITEM] What types of trophoblast are seen?
[NUMBERED_ITEM] Why is the placenta not rejected?
